diagnosis.final_diagnosis: metacestode infection caused by Versteria sp.
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of Versteria sp. infection was supported by clinical presentation, imaging findings, and histopathological evidence of extensive necrosis with granulomas and protoscolex. Cross-reactivity in serology with Echinococcus granulosus was noted, but negative results for E. multilocularis and confirming molecular tests pointed towards Versteria sp.
